feat.value: It’s not when the fox cries out, which is you, oh servant of Mammon, in voices that shout, that the lion, which is I, the servant of Christ, is afraid.
I know it’s not against me you fight, but against Jesus who dwells inside the Christians.
Jesus still conquers you yourself and your father the devil who dwells inside you, for which you hope.
And they too on their part, with their father who dwells inside them, Jesus, on whom they depend.
A person who has Jesus doesn’t ever have shame like you said.
The shame of this place [i.e. this life], the glory of this place, I have forsaken them, for I know that which I’m looking out for.
Those who have the glory and honor by the hand of Jesus what have they to do with the glory and honor of people?
Indeed just as there is no 'robbery' for those who truly have Jesus, as you said against me, since I have carried your gods quietly [i.e. took away your idols without them resisting],
and since I have had them bind your contempt and your shame to the gateposts of your house,
written on pieces of papyrus—as they broke your urine, in jars like wine —upon the threshold of your house, and on your door and the doors of those who are like you,
so also there is no freedom for those who trust in Kronos, which is you, and those who are like you in faithlessness and in every other impurity.
What act or which word among those which you have uttered is it, that does not constitute evidence against you that you belong to Satan?
It's the letters, those that you tore up—didn’t I know even before I had sent them that you would tear them up,
oh accomplice in the work of those who destroyed with the scribe’s knife the pages of the book of the words that the prophets sent in the name of God?—
they were thrown on the burning embers!
Even as you said: “the people and my stewards take things to him,”
it’s you telling us and revealing your evil, for it’s not that you want the children of God to carry an offering to his church,
or to do another thing which is good in the name of Jesus.
You will rejoice if you hear that they have gone to the oracles of demons,
because you also worship and serve the creation rather than he who created all things, Jesus, who is blessed for all eternity,
instead of listening or seeing them going to the feet of God in every place where he is called, and blessed, and given glory,
If more than the many about whom you said, “They take things to him,”
if they transfer over to me without restraint—for I too am a good servant to them, for they are my brothers, gathering for them into treasures in heaven, the things that they give in honour of God—
is it that they took them from your house and the house of your fathers?
You rob those that are not yours oh evil man.
You sin, however, and you lay down obstacles for those who give to the poor,
while they know that the things that are given or that are given in charity for those who are in need belong to Christ, who gave them to them for joy
and to be rich in deeds that are good.
Do I still sit upon the middle of your head?
For you say: 'Until what happens won't he sail away, since he says 'I will go', while he throws away day after day?'
Why is it that I’ve become this great burden down upon you in this whole way,
[whether] I have gone to the Emperors or I haven’t gone.
Aren’t the heavens and the land Christ’s, and all that is in them?
Does your father Kronos for his part indeed have anything at all except sins, these that you are a cultivator of for him yourself and those who are like you,
as you all sow and reap for him the acts of faithlessness and the lies, and the acts of violence, and the blasphemies and every evil deed.
If you were a weed like this growing by yourself then it would be right to tolerate you until the harvest of the field according to the word of the Lord that you blasphemed.
But you are a thorn tree and a thistle on the roads, as you form an obstacle to those who walk; for this it is right to cut and to pull out your root.
But since you still said in your empty words:
“If he were truly a monk then he wouldn’t have committed 3 murders in the 40 Days [=Lent],”
as you called the pigs and the cow that I slew in the houses of the pagans “murders”.
I will say for my part as follows against your nauseating words:
if what I did is not right because I made an example of idol worshippers, then how much of a condemnation is it for you that you transgressed in the 40 Days,
and in the great holy Easter that every one celebrates down to the God loving Emperors too.
But you for your part make your butchers work for you during it, while you live in luxury and stray without fear, making others stray with you
because still you sent to me saying:
“come search my houses (see) if you find idols inside them”
after I have searched it on another occasion;
your house - I didn’t find any idols in it.
Or don’t you have any others but those that I took?
Or if I take the idols that are in your house, is it that I’ll be able to hide the sun in the sky and the moon and the stars that you worship?
Or is it that I’ll build walls in the west so that you won’t pray to the west side?
Or is it that I’ll watch over the river and over your canals so you won’t pour libations for Kronos down into flood waters,
then that’s enough of you saying these words of blaspheme upon deception,
oh man who has fallen down to great evils.
For just as you are godless, so is the way that you oppress the poor in your violent doings,
or isn’t it another kind of persecution when you pursue men, most of all the elders of the church
until you scare them out of their houses, in this very period no less, right in these great troubles that are upon the land as you come into their places,
while there is no son and no father and nothing at all inside because they ran.
While you all take their beasts and their wagon, and their hay as you take them to your gardens as you force them to turn them around beyond their strength.
And what about the great Easter too, you don’t release them to engage in celebrating it.
Right down to new boats that you have built, and you make them launch them into the water during it [i.e. Easter], instead of mourning during it.
You have made them shout aloud while it’s not their desire,
who is he who will be able to recount all your evils?
As still you slaughter your calf when it is about to die, or if it exhausts [its] measure, being unuseful for your work,
and you divide it piece by piece as is your will, and you throw it at them, right down to the widows, and the old men, the old women, the orphans and the strangers.
And you extort them for copper beyond its value until you collect the price of the calf doubled for ones least of flesh, while they are bones on something useless.
As still you give calves to them and cows according to the field for them to feed until they are strong enough for you to take them.
Some of them to give them to you in honour, you do nothing good for them in exchange.
Whereas others are still fed to you in this way: horses, and asses, sheep, calves, and pigs.
Oh would that you all would stop in this way
for you would have desired them in their animals
or even in other matters
You rob them by using them,
some for naught,
and others with a little honor,
except for bread and wine, finding food and chaf.
And barley for your animals with all the others
And as still you gather them, to make them watch over you and the boats at the time while you flee in the face of the barbarians.
Or doesn't the barbarian chase after them?
It's their wives and their children and the furniture of their poverty upon their livestock.
And in their wagons as they run for their part out of their places to other places to make them rescue themselves.
This is the way that many of them hire men under their pay and send them to you to watch over you
And you are not content with these things.
But rather you still add to your violence.
Just as you still extort from some people a vessel full of wheat for the house,
because they are numerous—some twenty five dry measures, others one measure of grain.
through the pretext of washing in baths
as they weep, 'We don't want to to bathe.
We don't have bread to eat.
Such a thing is not our concern,
while our children are hungry, while our children are naked.'
While their majority testifies, 'We are not washing in baths.'
Aren't they the ones who force them until they build them [i.e. the baths]?
and other buildings as you force them concerning them [the buildings].
Or it's also farmsteads of a village.
Wasn't it you who also built their houses inside them?
And every single one of these acts of oppression, you were oppressing them inside with your vengeance and your wine that is foul, with your labors and your violence.
Oh you men whom a sound threatens, 'Those out of a quarrel who are disobedient of the truth,
but obey violence;
anger and rage and oppression,
and the crushing of every human soul that does something evil.'
However I will say in your presence, the Lord of powers, ruler of all, don't be angry at my stupidity.
I know that you do not forget anything.
You, who have spoken through your holy prophets in the presence of this boastful man there, Pharaoh: 'Let my people go,
so that they may serve me or celebrate for me.'
And you who have said through them, 'Be at ease, as you know that I am God,'
therefore, have pity on your people, o patient one, whose mercy is great.
As you rescue them from those who oppress them.
In the way of your people, Israel at that time, so that they shall be at ease to know that there is no other god but you.
Or don't you see that the pagans and the other peoples and the godless, were not able to know you, as they were not at ease in their apostasy?
And all their impurities.
Therefore, curb every lawlessness.
And every violence in every place.
From those who did violence to them, from the head of the land to the end of the world,
those who know you shall be at ease to serve you.
For they are not able to serve you, while they serve those who do violence.
Did you not rescue your people Israel on that occasion from the hand of that lawless Nebuchadnezzar,
and those others which are like him, who afflicted them in making you deliver them to their hands, since you were angry with them?
And they even ask after you in those places, but they wouldn't know to say your blessings in the way that they wish it.
As no open speech exists to them in the servitude of the deeds that are many.
In the way that they said: 'how will we be able to say the ode of the house of the lord in those of strange lands?'
In this way also if you don't rescue those who have violence done to them from the hands of these merciless ones,
although they proclaim your name, but they wish also to do their desire since you are their hope.
They will not be able to give you their vow.
In blessings and prayers and fasts, since no freedom exists for them right now in the servitude of the deeds of those men who think of wicked things at every hour inside them.
